1.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

2.text: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

3.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

4.text: Now Elihu had waited to speak unto Job, because they were elder than he.

5.text: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was kindled.

6.text: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I held back, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

7.text: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

8.text: But there is a spirit in man, and the breath of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

9.text: It is not the great that are wise, nor the aged that understand judgment.

10.text: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

11.text: Behold, I waited for your words, I listened for your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

12.text: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none that convinced Job, or that answered his words, among you.

13.text: Beware lest ye say, We have found wisdom; God may vanquish him, not man:

14.text: For he hath not directed his words against me; neither will I answer him with your speeches.

15.text: They are amazed, they answer no more: they have not a word to say.

16.text: And shall I wait, because they speak not, because they stand still, and answer no more?

17.text: I also will answer my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

18.text: For I am full of words; the spirit within me constraineth me.

19.text: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; like new bottles it is ready to burst.

20.text: I will speak, that I may be refreshed; I will open my lips and answer.

21.text: Let me not, I pray you, respect any manâ€™s person; neither will I give flattering titles unto any man.

22.text: For I know not to give flattering titles; else would my Maker soon take me away.
